items.question: Why do the gamblers wore heavy makeup?
items.answer: Because that was the fashion for wealthy, aristocratic men in Georgian era Europe- make-up, powdered wigs, ruffled collars, etc.

items.question: What is a "plug of tow" or "plug of toe" referred to after the first duel?
items.answer: Tow is a coarse, broken fibre, which removed during processing flax.

items.question: Is this movie based on a novel?
items.answer: Yes. The Luck of Barry Lyndon (1844) was written by English novelist William Makepeace Thackeray (1811-1863). It was first published in serial form and reissued under the title The Memoires of Barry Lyndon, Esq.

items.question: Was Barry Lyndon a real person?
items.answer: Thackeray based Barry Lyndon on the Anglo-Irish adventurer Andrew Robinson Stoney (1747-1810).

items.question: What is Lady Lyndon's first name?
items.answer: In the movie, the only reference to Lady Lyndon ()'s first name is when she signs the letter giving Barry his yearly dole: "H. Lyndon." In the book, her name is Honoria. Edit

items.question: Where is Castle Lyndon located?
items.answer: Castle Lyndon was actually filmed at Castle Howard in North Yorkshire, England.
